Award.AwardTitle: Student Housing and Symposium Support for 49th North American Power Symposium held at West Virginia University, Morgantown, WV, USA, September 17,- September 19, 2017

Division.LongName: Div Of Electrical, Commun & Cyber Sys

Award.AbstractNarration: This project provides funding to subsidize a student-oriented conference in power engineering, the 2017 edition of the North American Power Symposium (NAPS). Most of the funding will be used to support student-related travel expenses incurred by US university students attending the symposium, which will take place in Morgantown, WV during September 17-19, 2017. The symposium will be hosted by West Virginia University. NAPS is a nonprofit event with technical sponsorship from the Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE) and has a tradition of providing an opportunity for students to share their research with one another and with faculty and industry experts. The overwhelming majority of papers in NAPS are traditionally presented by students. NAPS has been supported by the National Science Foundation in the past, which has positively influenced student participation. In addition to providing subsidized accommodation for students, the organizers' efforts to foster and encourage student participation include a comprehensive student program, tours of nearby industry sites, and a student paper competition with awards. Moreover, measures will be taken to encourage participation of women and underrepresented minorities in the conference.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The 49th NAPS was held at West Virginia University September 17 – 19, 2017 that included 4 keynote speakers, 3 plenary speakers, 3 tutorial sessions, 2 technical tours, 1 social tours, 32 paper sessions for 253 papers (with about 8 papers per session). NAPS 2017 was technically co-sponsored by IEEE Power and Energy Society, National Science Foundation and West Virginia University. In addition, 49th NAPS conference organizers worked hard to involve industries to participate and obtained the following corporate financial sponsorship including Appalachian Power – An AEP Company, FirstEnergy Foundation, Dominion Energy, Nayak Corporation, RTDS, PSCAD and Spitzenbergen Spies, KeyLogic, Lucas-Nulle, Edibon International, FESTO, Opal-RT and West Virginia Higher Education.

 The symposium brought 200 organizations from 15 different countries. There were 253 technical papers accepted and 250 papers were presented in 32 technical sessions in the conference. There were 187 students and 95 non-student registrations. Overall the composition of the conference participation was 91% academia, 3% national labs and 6% industry participation in the conference. There was an exposition for vendors and many vendors participated including RTDS, Opal-RT, FESTO, EDIBON, and Lucas-Nulle. Each student presentation was judged by at least 5 non-students attendees’ and from about 200 presentations top six student received winner certificates and tokens.

 

Student Housing Program - the program provided free shared housing for students at the Conference Hotel (The Marriott Morgantown Waterfront Place).  The NAPS 2017 student program committee received housing requests from 170 students and all students received housing in a two-bedroom at the Conference Hotel for a total of 510 nights (each student 3 nights).

 The conference generated 250 full papers that are now available in IEEE Xplore.

 Overall, there was a unique, busy, vibrant, and fun-filled program relevant to the current issues facing the electric power profession.
